researchProcess: 1. Google 'best home sauna' or 'Huberman sauna protocol'
2. Read 2-3 articles, get overwhelmed by options
3. Ask successful friends in Slack/WhatsApp groups
4. Look for an expert or trusted curator to shortcut decision
5. Once decided, ready to purchase within 2 weeks
barriers: Uncertainty about which type (infrared vs traditional vs barrel)
Installation complexity - doesn't want to project manage
Spouse buy-in on aesthetics and yard space
Fear of it becoming another unused purchase
convincers: Clear, data-backed comparison from trusted source
Real testimonials from people 'like him' (other founders/execs)
Premium aesthetics that enhance property value
Protocol guidance that guarantees he'll actually use it
White-glove service - just tell him what to buy

budgetAndValue.priceInsensitivity: Will happily spend $20K-$50K on the right setup. Doesn't negotiate - values time over haggling. Would spend more if convinced it's meaningfully better.
budgetAndValue.valuePerception: Calculates ROI in terms of years of life, cognitive performance, and stress reduction. A $30K sauna that gives him 10 extra productive years is a bargain.
budgetAndValue.redFlags: Cheap-looking marketing, pushy sales tactics, lack of scientific backing, mass-market positioning

communicationPreferences.toneThatResonates: Sophisticated but not pretentious. Confident but not salesy. Data-driven but readable. Exclusive but not elitist.
keyMessagesThatWork: The definitive guide for serious wellness investors
What the world's top performers know about heat therapy
Science-backed protocols you won't find elsewhere
Curated by experts, for those who demand the best
